Something really interesting about this is that groups made up of folks who tested best in individual assesments - eg. Who you'd assume would be best for a job.

Perform worse than groups made of randomly selected individuals who took the same test but didn't do as well.

tweet:
Basically, if a homogeneous group encounter a difficult problem - they all get stuck *at the same time*.

Whereas cognitively diverse groups are more likely to solve problems faster.

From an ADHD slant, there are lots of studies that say that ADHD medication does not stunt growth in children, and also a lot of studies that say it does.
There's one I've just read though that seems to suggest ADHD kids trend smaller than average whether their on it or not.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
ADHDers don't procrastinate things they enjoy - because *nobody* does that by choice. 

We have specific, more accurate, less misleading, language for these behaviours and I just think we should be using that rather than the words that reinforce negative stereotypes about ADHD.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
When we differentiate the two, we can actually manage both better. 

Just noticing that I'm procrastinating will stop me now. 
And if it's Executive Dysfunction I'm experiencing, I can be a bit kinder to myself, + its an opportunity to use techniques I've learned to manage it.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Procrastination by both definition and  usage implies choice. Using it for ED opens up the window to self-blame and external blame.
It makes us feel bad about ourselves and makes others think we're not bothered, idle, lazy. Rather than, you know,  living with a disability.

It's possible that it's both.

description:

tweet:
@caiyzik @lilou_cormic @get_inflow Calling task initiation issues as a result of executive dysfunction "procrastination" can make people think that they are choosing to avoid tasks that they are not.
Which can cause issues with self-esteem, self-compassion.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
@caiyzik @lilou_cormic @get_inflow I agree, but procrastination and exec dysfunction are different. One is a choice, the other is not.
Procrastination = putting off something you don't want to do.
Task initiation problems affect everything regardless of desire.
Knowing the diff can help you to manage them.

Just like what happened with the pride flag.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: To an extent, I think they have a point, though not as much as is made out. But he has a big following so became a focus. It's important to remember here, the guy (who's like 21 btw) literally went and saw a doctor, ending with an autism diagnosis as a result.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
So autism TikTok is almost always having to fight this kind of misinformation and appropriation. The symbol, I think, gets wrapped up in that.
This is partly because a lot of autism TikTok saw that creator as a peddler of that kind of misinformation.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Outside of TikTok, the autistic reaction looks super gatekeepy. And it is, I suppose. But the landscape there is suuuuuper different.
The place is full of people claiming autistic traits, and language as part of something else. Usually "rare" ADHD traits but other nds too.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: But this whole conversation basically only happened on TikTok, and like every online community they assume that's where *the discourse* matters. Leaving us with weird remnants popping up like in the OPs screenshot.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: Autism TikTok kicks off, and accuses the creator of appropriation. Which starts a whole thing between ADHD TikTok and Autism TikTok. Which got in places really quite nasty. When the dust settles, for the most part ADHDers agree not to use the symbol.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
A guy makes a symbol to represent ADHD and that symbol incorporates the rainbow infinity symbol.
I'm not naming people here but for context this guy is both ADHD and autistic, but had not been dxed as Autistic until after all this.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: Anyway, we're left with a symbol that to a generation or so of folks only meant autism, that paradoxically has always meant neurodiversity. Now on to tiktok.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: There are serious parallels here between the gay pride movement, and the original iteration of the rainbow flag (which meant gay men), to the pride we have today and a version of that rainbow that represents everybody.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
This is what all good activism does. What happens later, is another thing that all good activism does - it becomes more inclusive.
And so Neurodiversity stops just meaning autism and grows into the umbrella we know it as today.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Neurodiversity and it's symbol were attempts to rebrand autism advocacy, incredibly successful and important ones.
They took what worked from other movements (eg the rainbow, "diversity" coded language) to define themselves in ways that are both sympathetic and easily understood.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
First off the Neurodiversity Vs Autism of this symbol is kinda complicated because they are both correct.
The symbol was created by autistm advocates to represent Neurodiversity, but at that time Neurodiversity literally only meant autism.

@lil_writer @grumpyshrubbery Again, you're assuming something that hasn't been said.

Trend = volume. Can make things more expensive or more scarce, can reduce the quality of items, can make it harder to find people with a similar level of interest as you, can mean more demands are made of you to "help"

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
@lil_writer @grumpyshrubbery *I* find this frustrating because it's harder for me to find people who are as into a thing as I am, for example.

It is perfectly valid to be annoyed by that, that's allowed. And it's not any sort of judgement on the people who've recently come to it.

So yeah, basically I think it creates more barriers to understanding. Which is not really what shorthand vernacular is supposed to do.

And it sounds vaguely like a threat, which isn't ideal.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

Be More Kind.
tweet: It is also *not entirely* true (though mostly). Which opens up the door for pointless whataboutery that'll end up with people having arguments about the phrase, rather than considering the point of it.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
It is already used in some contexts (insurance, benefit claims) to account for a currently disabled person's situation before they were disabled. 

So it has the potential to be more confusing than what we already have.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet: In conversation, *if someone even thinks to ask*, it will need to be explained, so you might as well just talk about it.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
It could, for example, refer to people with a diagnosed condition that is not yet disabling, but will inevitably become so.

So, in passing, it can be easily dismissed as "doesn't apply to me" which is the same problem we already have.

But it is still emotionally true to my experience of ADHD, and, as is often hugely gratifying and validating, a lot of other people as well.

tweet:
@neurorebelde The OP of my QT shared an example of someone saying
"I don't drink wine..."
Which is used to imply a caveat, or an unspoken explanation.
Eg - "but I do drink whisky" or "because of that time I drank to much and stole an elephant"

Which, again, the reader is meant to infer.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

Be More Kind.
tweet:
@neurorebelde Well... Someone might use an elipses to denote a pause as they think of the right way to respond to something.

Or as a silent response to something, to show hesitation or consideration - which often needs to be inferred from context.
"Why do that?"
"..." 
"Well?"

These are folks for whom ADHD was impairing enough that it was noticed and diagnosed, even with additional support (eg. Tutors), 

BUT,

Are wealthy enough, that knowledge of ADHD means they're better able to effectively access and use targeted support.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
And so you're more likely to have it negatively affect your life. And be diagnosed.

This might explain to some extent the desire to describe ADHD as a superpower in some communities (usually wealthy, white and male).

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø

tweet:
As it stands currently, impact/impairment is a requirement for an ADHD diagnosis.

Basically, if you're poor you're less likely to be able to afford the kind of support that might lessen the effect of symptoms/traits.

It is hugely more manageable, average life expectancy is up by decades and quality of life is vastly improved.

Fun times.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: So let's say, youve sensory issues with some foods, which thanks to poor understanding from childhood guardians leads to traumatic experiences, meaning you avoid food or fear certain foods, which can exacerbate already low interoception, which can increase food sensitivities.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Sensory based avoidance:
I mean, we've all got this with something to some level.

Concern about consequences of eating:
This is stuff like, fear of choking/vomiting etc.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
So let's break some stuff down.

Apparent lack of interest:
We've got famously bad interoception, we might not notice were actually hungry.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Common misconception to bat out of the way - you do not have to be at a low weight. As significant nutritional deficiency does not require this.

You could be high weight or gaining weight - if, say, your safe foods just so happen to be high calorie, low nutrition.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
So, essential criteria resulting from A/R behaviour. You only need 1 of these, can have more.

1: Significant weight loss
2: Significant nutritional deficiency.
3: Dependence on enteral feeding or oral nutritional supplements.
4: Marked interference with psychosocial functioning.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: Pretty much all the info sources you'll find for it will take the time to note how prevalent it is in ADHD and/or autistic folks.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
This sentence from the DX criteria is all you need to know about WHY it's particular common in us.

"apparent lack of interest in eating or food; avoidance based on the sensory characteristics of food; concern about aversive consequences of eating"

Ohhhhhh shiiiit. Right?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
It stands for Avoidant/Restrictive Food Intake Disorder.

If you're the sort of person who says things like:
 "I can go days without food" 
 "I just don't get hungry"
 "I only eat when I'm starving" 

you may wanna pay attention.

tweet:
@autie_anna It's not proven though. 

In terms of experience I think there's an issue of undiagnosed cooccurence + wildly different presentations capable in both which means that depending on who you're looking at it could be a very similar experience or a very different one.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
@autie_anna Essentially I think the research (from memory) is based on evidence that suggests ADHD and Autism have the same abnormalities in the same genes.
Developmentally they affect the same regions of the brain, and so, essentially they could just be two versions of how that can go.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
@hutchleah Yeah that's interesting. I kinda think if the patient wants the diagnosis and qualifies for it, it shouldn't be up to the Dr to make that judgement for them?

In adults with consent capacity at the very least.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
@autie_anna I don't think they're the same in experience, but being both it's hard to rly tell outside of what other people tell me.
I'm sceptical of people who "know" what's causing one thing or the other in cooccurence cos like, wow, how?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
@autie_anna there's actually ongoing research into the two being different presentations of the same thing. There seems to be a genetic link. ADHD parents are more likely to have autistic children than NTs and vice versa.  
And cooccurence is so high you're more likely to have both than one.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
I don't know everything, I'm still very much working it out myself. And that will be a life's work.

I've hit some milestones on these apps this week, and with it has come an influx of people invalidating me, telling me I'm not disabled, or an advocate.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
I present myself well, because, in trying to make my experience understandable for other people, it makes it easier for me to understand it myself.

I love that it resonates with people but I get just as much from that validation, of not being alone, as you do. I promise.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø

I am not untouchable. I'm human. With all the associated flaws an insecurities.
I'm ADHD, I'm autistic, I'm depressed, anxious, have PTSD, cptsd, arfid.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

Be More Kind.
tweet:
So:
Hyperfocus - short term, impersonal, unimportant.
Hyperfixation - medium term, impersonal, important
Special interest - long term, personal, important
5/5

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Special interest - can last months to forever basically. It can be difficult to tell between a fixation and a SI.

The core difference being a much deeper connection to identity - even if I move on, a special interest will still feel like a part of me.

4/5

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Hyperfixation - is longer term, ranging from a few days to potentially years.
It'll be consuming, and may be the trigger for related hyperfocuses throughout.
It may be all I want to do/talk about for however long it lasts - but - when I'm done with it, I'm done with it.
3/5

2/5

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
I think we've all been close to the edge at some point. And I think, at the wrong time, that's enough to push someone off. 

And I can never know if it's that moment for someone.

I don't think a tweet exists that makes me comfortable with rolling that dice.
4/4

description:

tweet:
But even amongst generally respectful groups, will usually end up with an awful lot of people with MH wading in to tell one person with MH they're wrong.

That can be overwhelming and cause distress, to the same level as crueler mobbing, even when the discourse is polite. 3/4

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:

From what I've seen QT, @-ing, identifying almost always leads to a certain level of mobbing. Sometimes this can lead to very unsavoury behaviour. 2/4

tweet:
If we lose something, we look for it.
If we find something we forgot we owned, we understand it's been there the whole time.
If food rots in the fridge, we understand that it was once fresh and we'd forgotten to cook it.

We Do Not Lack Object Permanence.

Be More Kind.
tweet: @hekenbitchell yeah, I think so? Sorry that's a difficult sentence for me to put together. We've basically all got one or all of depression, anxiety, ptsd or cptsd as well. which obviously affect memory also.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: @hekenbitchell I can't but it's what I talk about every day, and why people follow me so while I wouldn't say that this should be part of the dx criteria (or universal trait) i can say it's clearly a commonly felt experience of ADHD people and so it *is* an ADHD experience.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: @hekenbitchell Yeah these things don't work in isolation. Intense but fleeting emotional responses, emotional dysregulation, working memory (and let's face it, people pleasing which is probably a trauma response but super common in ADHD) all mashed in.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
@hekenbitchell It's more forgetting the intensity of the feelings associated. So you might feel very wronged in the moment but then sleep on it and be like yeah whatever even if it's a big thing.
Working memory is basically any kind of information processing not just where are my keys.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
@ChrisNight6 Focuses and Foci are both correct in English. 
Hyper is Greek and Focus is Latin so it's a pretty standard faux medical word.
Foci is more often used in medical contexts, but 'hyperfocus' isnt really a medical term.
It's normal folk word so should hold to the English focuses.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø

tweet: @JellybeansThe Well perseveration acting as it is defined, yes.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Cos when you say it's a controllable 'power' publicly you're going to be invalidating the experience of people who haven't learned how to enter flow(which is doable fyi). 
But do regularly experience perseveration.
As you're conflating the two, and you might not even realise.
4/4

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
I say regularly cos,  you can choose to start a task and end up in perseveration but like, that's not an all the time ability.

That's cool. incidentally. Better even, but it's important to know the difference cos then you can understand what you're telling others about.
3/4

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
As an ND person it's important to know that you will experience both of these.

If you can still get up to go to the loo or have a snack/switch to something you forgot you needed to do. If you regularly can choose to enter it.

That's flow.
2/4

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
As this is hyperfocus day.

Flow - being rly into a task and totally vibing it. All people get this. And it still lets you go to the bathroom

Perseveration - is the getting stuck on a task, being unable to switch from it and ignoring your body's signals. Thats us.
1/4 https://t.co/q404kUW7bl

This actually helps to understand some of the superpower narrative. Having your base needs met by someone else, and being free to follow your dreams is a privilege.

And you may notice, an awful lot of ADHD is a superpower folks are white guys named Chad.
4/4

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Which I've heard a lot, I think the answer is pretty simple.

They're more often encouraged to indulge their passions and have far fewer things to manage (from taxes to meals to bedtimes) and so fewer demands on their executive function.

They're more free. Basically. 3/4

tweet:

I think it just helps me overcome the executive dysfunction preventing me from starting a task I literally always hyperfocus on.

When it comes to kids being 'better' at controlling it 2/4

tweet:
So a note on channeling hyperfocus.
I don't think that's what's happening.
I think that sometimes you have the executive function to start a task *which you find interesting* so you enter hyperfocus.
That happens to me with writing, alll the time, I used to think that I could 1/4 https://t.co/gQ5Z3R2EKJ

description:

tweet:
Just as like an fyi - hyperfocus as it pertains to us (and brain injuries) is not a superpower. 

It can be useful, hell, it can be useful *a lot* - if you're lucky.

But it's defined by a lack of choice and an inability to stop.

So. 
You know.
Shhh.

@DaisyVicEdwards This depends on the individual psych, but once you're going for the assessment, you'll essentially be asked a series of questions from the DSM, a good psych will ask around those as well.
Either way, you'll once again be glad you did the research and wrote it down at the start.

tweet:
@DaisyVicEdwards Your other option is going fully private - most will want a GP referral, although you can go to psychiatryUK without one (you'll have to pay then).
Costs vary, shop around, make sure you find someone who specialises in ADHD, and treats ADHD women.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Hyper empathy:
Hearing someone speak in a foreign  language. Tone, mood but no understanding.

Empathy:
Hearing the same thing but in a language you understand.

You can be either, you can be both, but one doesn't automatically mean the other.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
@awoke1971 Hyper empathy is a trauma related defense mechanism that makes you hyper sensitive to other's moods. Usually causing you to share them. 

Empathy requires you to share and understand the feelings, where they come from.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø

tweet:
That doesnt mean self-dx *cant* be wrong. But without an official Dx - they can't legally access medication. So bin that argument thanks.
They can try lifestyle tips.
And here's the thing.
It will help.
Because.
They would help anyone.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
People often DM me asking for help working out if they are or aren't ND.

On 5 occasions now, someone's sent me a 20-30 page doc, deck, PDF listing all their behaviours since childhood and how they relate to ND.

Does any NT spend this much effort trying to work out their brain?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: - folks self-dxing have often done more reading (and more recent reading) on the subject than those 'qualified' to make diagnoses.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: - NDs are massively stigmatised in pretty much every country. People judge you. They can affect your career regardless of performance. In some places they can be used as evidence to restrict your human rights or access to your children.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
- Assessments are hard to access. In some countries they cost a lot, in others they take a long time.
There are often long laborious processes involved that are difficult to manage if you actually are ND. (eg. my wife literally had to do all the admin and chasing for me)

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: - Dx is massively biased. Anything other than a white guy and you're likely to not get a Dx, or be misdiagnosed.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: - when parents talk to psychs, psychs most often *dont* explore whether the parent themselves might be ND. So if a parent thinks their child behaviour was typical. That's literally enough to not get a Dx.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: - also, NDs are genetic and heritable. So, even if your parents aren't predisposed to not wanting you to be dxed. It's entirely possible they view your childhood behaviour as typical. Because it's how they/their relatives behaved as kids.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: - official diagnostics often require the input of parents. Generational and general stigma of Neurodivergence means older folks are far more likely to view their child's disability as negative reflection on them. Or want to protect their children from a Dx they think is 'bad'

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Self-dx neurodivergence is valid because:

- official diagnostic criteria is woeful and often centres the experience of others. How your behaviour affect them. Rather than how it effects you.

Ta.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

Be More Kind.
tweet:
Going to explain why this matters.
One group has sugar pill. One has adderall. Both believe its adderall.

Sugar pills did better - they believed they would on meds.

Adderallers also believed it - which means meds *impeded* their performance. 

https://t.co/FO9j2svUZ2

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: - statistically NTs who misuse adderall or ritalin are no more likely to become drug addicts than the rest of the population.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
- ADHDers are actually slightly less likely to achieve expected grades even when on medication - though perform better (and are less likely to drop out) than those without. 

- adderall can actually harm study in NTs because it can cause overstimulation. Which is a medium lol.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
- adderall and ritalin have been shown numerous times to not improve cognitive function, and to actually impair working memory in NTs.

- adderall doesn't even seem to improve cognitive function in ADHDers, though it does help control behaviours which can disrupt study.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Was gonna do a whole sources thing but now I've read too much. Can't find the original study I was referring to but other learnings. These are all quick Googles. 

- adderall is less effective than a placebo at improving academic performance in NTs.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
TL;DR - academic doping is BS ableist propaganda that undermines ADHD experience and makes it more difficult to access Dx and treatment.

And we need to stop accepting and perpetuating it.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
But - it's not what's actually happening en masse. So we really need to stop believing those arguments, or responding to those claims.

Someone comes at you with that, don't try and win or equivocate. Just be like - 'oh that's a common myth, do the reading and come back to me'

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
This makes us doubt *each other*, it makes us look at anyone from friends to tiktokkers and be like 'oh rly tho'.

And I'm not saying that no non-ADHDers effectively use adderall to be productive. It's probably *possible* to have a healthy relationship to any drug.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
It's a bit of incredibly effective propaganda, that tackles a problem that doesn't exist - which literally only makes life harder for ADHD folks.

And here's the internalised ableism.
I literally believed it until I read up on it. And all those associations that come with it.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
...and this one is the real kicker.

ADHD meds have been proven to reduce the likelihood of addictive behaviours in ADHDers. So, by scaring parents into denying access to meds, they're actually *increasing* the chances of addiction.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Parents are quite naturally unlikely to want their children to get addicted to drugs and die. And so can resist enabling diagnosis or treatment. 

- this has the added effect of... Well, all of the above for actual ADHDers.

BUT ALSO....

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: 4. From drug abuse you can manipulate *parents* - who are required for diagnosis, possibly to pay for the meds in countries like the USA (but even elsewhere, as they're often required to provide evidence of an adult's childhood behaviour).

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
3. Together these let you build the narrative of drug abuse. Adderall is a stimulant > people fake adhd for grades > get hooked > die. 

- this has the added effect of stigmatising actual ADHDers for using medication, while making it harder for them to access it.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
2. That let's you make the argument that ADHD is over-diagnosed, by creating the perception that people are seeking diagnosis purely to cheat.

- this has the added effect of making it much harder for actual ADHDers to get a diagnosis

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
1. It creates a perception that ADHD drugs are widely (and effectively) used to cheat.

- this has the added effect of undermining the achievements of actual ADHDers on meds.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Academic Doping with Adderall is largely a made up problem.

But. 

Academic Doping *concerns* are a brilliant way to attack ADHD (and ADHDers by extension).

It let's you do 4 things all at the same time.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Learning this was important for me.

ADHD (in the USA especially) has become a sort of moral panic. But... Its hard to fight doctors.

So, as with all moral panics, they start to try and pin things that society considers wrong on it.

In this case. Cheating.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Mythbusting ableism?

I'll start.

Non-ADHDers, who take adderall to help them study, are statistically *more likely to fail* than the non-ADHDers who don't.

ADHD students who take adderall are statistically *as likely to pass or fail* as non-ADHDers who don't take adderall. https://t.co/VHA2WDD4Me

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
@tethysia Think of a task you really struggle with. OK it's boring. But do you find it harder than other 'boring' tasks?

Ok Well, why?
Beyond boring, do you want to do it? Does it need to be done? 
Do you think it's useful to you? Does it align with a vision you have of the future?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Because knowing why, even if it *is* boring, helps you to get it done.

It's like mindfulness. Oh, that's the thought I'm having.

It shrinks it. It's not some terrifying prospect anymore.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
ADHD meds help you focus. They do not choose what you focus on.

If you can, get therapy. If you can't, you need to interrogate the emotions behind your resistance to tasks.

You need to work out *why* you don't want to do things, and that's usually deeper than - it's boring.

tweet:
We're taught about neurodivergence like we're taught maths. Plus and minus. Surplus or deficit.

It's defined by its position to the median experience. Neurotypicality.

It's more like the difference between languages. Communication.

With no method more valid than any other.

tweet:

He hasn't, doesn't and won't take responsibility for that. Its a resentment that clearly I've held on to and feel very strongly, even though I thought I'd moved on.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
There was absolutely no hope of that conversation being a rational one. Because I, in effect, walked into his front room shouting.

And there were... Things about our relationship I'd been deeply unhappy about for a while.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
My first message was essentially a response to every single point I'd thought of in that time. And every single possible answer he might have.

It doesn't matter that... Actually I do believe I was right to feel hurt, it was a deliberately hurtful comment they made.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
I'd been triggered. I didn't know it. I won't go through the whole linking process but I'd been having flashbacks to my dad's death the whole time. Permanent high stress.

So when I address it - I'm already furious. Absolutely raging. I don't address my issue...

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
Some of my experience is wrapped in trauma. I *very recently* had an argument with a friend over a days old comment. That I don't think they'd really thought about.

I however had been in that argument since I first heard it.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

Be More Kind.
tweet: I don't do it on here really. Well, my drafts are filled with them. But I think, this place is public, and a lot of people do what I do in private here. Angry, shouting, but not realising. That puts me off enough, enough of the time.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
In text I will unfurl all of my angry irrationality as another might in a heated in-person row.

But because I am not physically shouting I don't necessarily realise I'm doing it until later. Or at least, until its too late.

It's not all-caps but I am absolutely off on one.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
I perceive speech and text differently. Despite the fact that I write as I would speak. I'm far less aware of the impact of text on both myself and other.

Which is to say. What I've learned is. Actually, I shout. A lot.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
Internally, I am on fire. I'm just repressing it all. This isn't healthy *anyway*

But... I've learned recently of something else deeply troubling. That I think might actually be useful to the twitter crowd to think on in themselves.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

Be More Kind.
tweet:
I can tell you every single time in my adult life that I have shouted. It is such a traumatic experience for me that they burn themselves into my brain.

This, to others, can make me look... Reasonable. I don't lose my head, I keep my cool, I'm calm.

I'm not.

tweet:
This is how I work out how good a friend might be for me.
A - shared interest
B - able to talk about it for hours
C - able to talk about anything other than that for 1hr+ (bonus per topic)
D - able to not talk at all and be comfy 
E - shared politics
F - shared perspective.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø

tweet: Make sure you like the person. And that they like you. I'm not talking about schoolyard like-like love equivalencies. I'm talking friendship. Love is weird and ethereal and emotional. You need love. But an awful lot of people in love are incredibly shitty to each other.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø

tweet: When I look back at previous relationships - when an NT has told me how they actually really feel, it's a signal for a status change. They hold it in til they can't take it. I find when NTs are honest, it's about things they mean to act on rn, rather than pure integrity.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
1: Honesty.
Obviously right, even the NTs talk about honesty. In my experience though, it's a different kind of honesty. And I find that they find the ADHD/ND brand pretty intimidating.
Aaand I think I know why.

Do you wish you'd being diagnosed earlier?
Yes.
And no.
Hard to look over life and not see those specific moments where knowing might have helped.
But also, who would I be now? My wife, my friends. Do I still meet them?
It wasn't and so it is.
What if? doesn't help anyone.

G.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
@thefabmads @AskADHD I think... Inconvenience is the biggest barrier to being treated well. If it seems like a lot of work, it'll be harder to convince them.
So come at it like a pro and be willing to take on the implementation work where appropriate.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
@thefabmads @AskADHD So, assuming your employer knows.
Look up the accommodations you think would help you (or are possible).
Make a list of what you'd like, and work out how they can be implemented.
Go to your employer with this and tell them how this will improve your health *&* productivity.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

Be More Kind.
tweet:
He wasn't posh, but he wasn't poor. He was a 'commoner' though. 

See, it's so unbelievable to them that the son of glove maker made something so timelessly brilliant that they have to pretend he didn't. That it *must* have been bacon, or the queen or whoever.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: And I say poor-er because ya know, he wasn't bad off. His dad was a glove maker, working class, but he was successful. Billie probably went to grammar school. But in them days, middle to upper was a starker gap than today, and his dad's occupation mattered to status.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
The theory didn't even get off the ground until the mid to late 19th century. Like a solid 250 years after the dude died.

And it's driven by one thing, rich people do not like thinking that poorer people are smarter than them.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
That's some privilege in the 16th century let me tell you. 

Some 'anti-statfordians' like to say it was a mix of all of them. Some say Shakespeare was paid off, and some, really quite ridiculously, claim that Shakespeare didn't exist at all.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: There's also some nonsense about Queen Elizabeth being the secret author... She was also quite well to do. And lastly Christopher Marlow, who was the son of a shoe maker but went to King's School and got a bachelor of arts from corpus Christie, Cambridge

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: Also, Edward de Vere, the Earl of Oxford who was... Well, he was an Earl. Indeed, some evidence to prove Bacon as the author seems to have been fabricated to deal with the fact the Earl of Oxford theory was gaining in popularity. Bacon-stans don't mess around.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: Anyway, you know who they try and attribute his work to? Mainly, Francis Bacon, Queens counsellor, Lord chancellor and 1st Viscount St Albans. Posh guy, really posh. Mates with the Queen posh.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet: Anyway, that theory didn't pop up until roughly 160 years after he died. Given that we're talking about a time where people were lucky to get to 60, thats a fair few steps.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
Slack, social media, emails. Its not a style choice, it's a rejection of, or inability to see, the point of changing my voice to suit a formal context.
And that, is what I think a lot of people are relating to here.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
See I'm not just talking about prose here. I *can't* just write a news piece or technical document like B of the bat. Or, at least, I can but it'll take me 10x longer than if I write A first and edit into B.
But that's true of other professional communication too.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø

tweet:
How we often fail, or don't even see the point in, adjusting and augmenting our behaviour or speech for different contexts.
Ie. We act and speak the same way with an employer as we would a friend.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet: And so back to the Qtd. I read up a lot. You might say I hyperfocused on it. And while, yes, I found a lot that made sense, it wasn't until I started engaging with ADHD communities online that I started seeing real life, relatable examples of what I actually experienced.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
ADHD didn't get that name until I was 1. And the criteria we have for it wasn't til I myself was 22.
It wasn't actually until a friend suggested it to me Last Year, that I thought ADHD was even a possibility for me - because understanding is so poor, I had no idea what it was rly

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: My mum, almost certainly has it, and I can see traits of ADHD and autism throughout her side of the family. So she would have perceived my behaviour as normal. Also, she had me late. She's in her 70s now. 'hyperkinetic impulse disorder' wasn't recognised until she was 22.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
See I was diagnosed late, at 34.
Part of that is I don't fit in to some of the typical stereotypes. I'm ADHD-C, and clinically more hyperactive - but, that hyperactivity is mostly internal. I also grew up poor, where adhd kids are more likely to be dismissed as 'naughty'

@MatsMusings Well. What I've read is that vit c can break down stims which causes hem to run out quicker/be absorbed slower. So shout avoid an hour before/after.
But also, that massive vit c doses can cause your body to dump your meds quickly (with the vit c) whenever you take it.

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
Isolation is torture for a kid with ADHD. No stimulation. At all.

But even for neurotypical kids, it's hard to see it as anything other than a labour camp. 

It's not breaking rocks, but it's just as pointless, and have you spotted the Fatal flaw in this system?
/?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
What do you do in isolation? You do lines. It's all lines here. 

All day, with nobody to talk to, writing the words over and over. 

And yes, isolation consequences use another different colour paper.

So I'm drowning in "Consequences" and now the school are taking an hour out of my day, every day, with after school detention. 

What do you do in detention? You write lines. The same form, the same rules, but on different coloured paper.
/?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

Be More Kind.
tweet:
It doesn't take very long before I'm taking home a forest worth of lines, every day. 

I can't do it.
So, I get detention.
And now I'm in a position where if I don't get my lines done, don't get the work done or don't go to detention. I get more lines and more detention  /?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:

And they escalate, if you fail to do your lines - OR - the original thing you were punished for, you move up to the next level. 

/?

/?

Look at the highest ranking sites you can find in your niche and see if you can guest post - linking back to your site in copy/bio

Its a minefield!

Does he have problems with authority(I did)?

A lot of traditional punishment/reward structures can actually have opposite effects for ADHD - so I'd look into that

description:

tweet:
Being diagnosed (w/meds) can help you to weaponise. Learn what triggers it/how to break out. It's not easy and you might do yourself a mischief but you can overclock your cpu at will.
That *can* feel like a superpower, but you can also melt your hard drive.
#actuallyadhd

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: Obviously that can lead to getting some incredible things done v quickly, but also spending lots of time on things that are useless. It'll also burn you out right quick. 3/?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
2 - perseveration: which is essentially the inability to switch tasks. To stop. That's the adhd Hyperfocus.
Someone could start talking to you, the sun goes down, you need to eat or sleep and you just don't notice. You're stuck, essentially. 3/?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet:
You can sort of break Hyperfocus/hyperfixation down to two things.
1 - flow: which is like getting into the vibe on a project, loving it and feeling deeply engaged. That's not an ADHD thing in itself, everybody does this from time to time. 2/?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: Worth adding from #MorningLive chat. I often fall into trap of calling adhd a superpower, cos when it's finally treated, that's how you feel. Happens esp with Hyperfocus. But not always helpful. Adhd is a disability and Hyperfocus has consequences and can be super unhealthy. 1/?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
Of course, now that I'm totally firing I'm trying to do everything, so I still need to calm my ass down before burnout. But if you want to try meds and are scared they'll change who you are.
1. They wont
2. Things that might change are things you don't like about yourself
#ADHD

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

Be More Kind.
tweet:
Some people don't like ADHD meds because they think it dulls their creativity.
I haven't experienced that (the opposite, in fact), but... Honestly if you're unable to act on your ideas, does it even matter that you had them? 5/?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:
Writer - ADHD - #ActuallyAutistic - Neurodivergent advocacy. BLM - Trans Rights. ADHD is: Tweets with a (sub)cultured side-eye. He/Him. 
Be More Kind.
tweet: Honestly for a lot of my life I've felt sort of trapped in my own body. Especially when it comes to personal projects. Things without deadlines, things for me. I'm full of ideas, constantly thinking and planning and then... Unable to act on it. 4/?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

Be More Kind.
tweet:
Part of this is impetus, really you should do CBT with ADHD meds to deprogram behaviours gained from years of living with a disability you didn't know you had.
For me, I have always filled my brain with ways of being productive, self improvement.
On meds, I can do them. 3/?

name: Geraint Evans üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å∑Û†Å¨Û†Å≥Û†Åø
description:

tweet:
My experience on ADHD meds is, that... hasn't happened.
I think in the exact same way as I did before except now I'm able to do things I want/need to do when I want/need to do them.
I'm also able to plan and prioritise those things effectively. 2/?
